intro: Leucosyke celebica, commonly known as the Celebes whitebark, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, compound leaves, and small white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
